{{cpp/title|popcount}}
{{cpp/utility/bit/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=bit|since=c++20|
template&lt; class T &gt;
constexpr int popcount( T x ) noexcept;
}}

Returns the number of {{c|1}} bits in the value of {{c|x}}.

{{cpp/enable_if|{{tt|T}} is an unsigned integer type (that is, {{c/core|unsigned char}}, {{c/core|unsigned short}}, {{c/core|unsigned int}}, {{c/core|unsigned long}}, {{c/core|unsigned long long}}, or an extended unsigned integer type)}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|x|value of unsigned integer type}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
The number of 1 bits in the value of {{c|x}}.

===Notes===
{{petty|The name {{tt|popcount}} is a contraction for "population count".}}

{{feature test macro|__cpp_lib_bitops|std=C++20|value=201907L|[[cpp/numeric#Bit manipulation (since C++20)|Bit operations]]}}

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;bit&gt;
#include &lt;bitset&gt;
#include &lt;cstdint&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

static_assert(std::popcount(0xFULL) == 4);

int main()
{
    for (const std::uint8_t x : {0, 0b00011101, 0b11111111})
        std::cout &lt;&lt; "popcount( " &lt;&lt; std::bitset&lt;8&gt;(x) &lt;&lt; " ) = "
                  &lt;&lt; std::popcount(x) &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
popcount( 00000000 ) = 0
popcount( 00011101 ) = 4
popcount( 11111111 ) = 8
}}
